description: Demonstrates first-class browser automation. The phase's `browser` config automatically spawns a headless browser subprocess, navigates to the URL, and cleans up when the phase ends. No manual server management needed.

phases.name: browse
phases.instructions:
You are browsing {{ input.url }} in a headless browser.

The browser session is ALREADY STARTED and navigated to the URL.
You can see the initial screenshot.

Your task:
1. Examine the screenshot to understand the page layout
2. Use extract_page_content to get the page content and clickable element coordinates
3. Interact with the page using control_browser
4. Report what you found

Remember the workflow:
- Move mouse to target: [":move-mouse", ":to", x, y]
- Then click: [":click"]
- Type text: [":type", "hello"]
- Scroll: [":scroll-wheel-down", 3]

The browser will be automatically closed when this phase ends.
